Class TerminalWrapper

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.tui.TerminalWrapper
public class TerminalWrapper extends Object
Wrapper class around a Terminal object made available by the JLine3 library.

  • Constructor Details

    • TerminalWrapper

      public TerminalWrapper(TUIView view) throws IOException
      Constructs a TerminalWrapper object tied to a TUIView.
      Parameters:
      view - TUIView View bound to the object.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the Terminal couldn't be created.

  • Method Details

    • setupHooks

      private void setupHooks()
      Sets up the hooks to the system signals that could affect the terminal object.

    • setupBindings

      private org.jline.keymap.KeyMap<org.jline.reader.Widget> setupBindings(TUIView view)
      Returns a keymap properly set up for the inputs the TUIView requires.
      Parameters:
      view - TUIView View that will be notified of ESC/Enter keypresses.
      Returns:
      A properly set-up keymap.

    • readBinding

      public org.jline.reader.Widget readBinding()
      Reads the first binding made available by the terminal, or waits until one is available.
      Returns:
      Widget Widget representing the action tied to the binding.

    • isAvailable

      public boolean isAvailable()
      Any methods regarding the input string are not synchronized to avoid the overhead of atomic changes, as There's only one producer (this object) and only one consumer.
      Returns:
      Whether the input string is available or not.

    • takeInput

      public String takeInput()
      Returns the input string set by the user. Any methods regarding the input string are not synchronized to avoid the overhead of atomic changes, as There's only one producer (this object) and only one consumer.
      Returns:
      The input string.

    • peekInput

      public String peekInput()
      Peeks the input string without consuming it. Any methods regarding the input string are not synchronized to avoid the overhead of atomic changes, as There's only one producer (this object) and only one consumer.
      Returns:
      The input string.

    • print

      public void print(String string, int row, int scol)
      Entry point for any external usage of the terminal, Prints to screen starting from the specified cell.
      Parameters:
      string - String to be printed.
      row - Row of the starting cell.
      scol - Column of the starting cell.

    • printBottom

      public void printBottom(String string, int offset)
      Prints a string with an offset from the bottom line.
      Parameters:
      string - String to be printed.
      offset - Desired number of rows below of the string.

    • print

      public void print(Collection<String> lines, int srow, int scol)
      Prints a collection of strings starting from the specified cell, and moving downwards.
      Parameters:
      lines - Strings to be printed.
      srow - Row of the starting cell.
      scol - Column of the starting cell.

    • printCentered

      public void printCentered(Collection<String> lines)
      Prints a collection of strings starting centering it automatically.
      Parameters:
      lines - Strings to be printed.

    • printCenteredCorner

      public void printCenteredCorner(List<String> lines)
      Prints a collection of strings starting centering it automatically based on the first line.
      Parameters:
      lines - Strings to be printed.

    • puts

      public void puts(org.jline.utils.InfoCmp.Capability capability, Object... params)
      Prints a InfoCmp.Capability on the screen.
      Parameters:
      capability - InfoCmp.Capability to be printed.
      params - Parameters regarding the capability.

    • cleanUp

      private void cleanUp(org.jline.terminal.Attributes a)
      Method run at shutdown to return the terminal to the state it was before the TUI launched.
      Parameters:
      a - Attributes Attributes representing the previous state of the Terminal.

    • showSmallScreen

      private void showSmallScreen(org.jline.terminal.Size s)
      Prints warning screen related to insufficient size parameters.
      Parameters:
      s - Size Current size of the terminal.
